senses.de: To find the answer or explanation for something
senses.ex: I can't solve this mathematics problem.

Tips.title: Math and Logic
Tips.description: Often used in academic contexts, especially in mathematics, logic, and puzzles.
Tips.example: Can you solve this equation for x?

Tips.title: Seeking Explanations
Tips.description: Used when looking for a clear answer or clarification to a complex issue.
Tips.example: Scientists strive to solve the mysteries of the universe.

Tips.title: Abstract Problems
Tips.description: Appropriate for abstract or conceptual problems, not just tangible ones.
Tips.example: Philosophers have attempted to solve the problem of free will.

senses.de: To deal successfully with a problem or difficult situation
senses.ex: The company hired a consultant to help solve their financial issues.

Tips.title: Business Challenges
Tips.description: In a business setting, it involves finding practical solutions to strategic or operational issues.
Tips.example: We need to solve the delay in product delivery.

Tips.title: Action-Oriented
Tips.description: Implies taking steps to actively address and overcome a difficulty.
Tips.example: The team solved the scheduling conflict with a new plan.

Tips.title: Conflict Resolution
Tips.description: Can refer to resolving interpersonal or international disputes and conflicts.
Tips.example: The mediator helped to solve the disagreement between the parties.

senses.de: To clear up or figure out something such as a crime
senses.ex: The detective solved the crime within a few days.

Tips.title: Crime Investigation
Tips.description: Primarily used in the context of police work or detective stories to mean figuring out a crime.
Tips.example: The FBI solved the case after decrypting the evidence.

Tips.title: Mystery Genre
Tips.description: Commonly found in mystery or thriller genres, whether in books, TV shows, or movies.
Tips.example: The novel revolves around a private investigator solving a high-profile murder.

Tips.title: Finality
Tips.description: When solving a case, it means the investigation is concluded with all questions answered.
Tips.example: After years of inquiry, the crime was finally solved.

Answer.wordDefinition:
Answer means to reply to a question or provide a response to a problem. It's usually used when a clear and straightforward solution or explanation is required.

For example, if someone asks what the capital city of France is, the answer is Paris. But if a math problem must be worked out or a puzzle needs to be solved, we use the word solve.

Decipher.wordDefinition:
Decipher is used when trying to figure out the meaning of something that is difficult to understand or interpret, particularly when it comes to codes or hidden messages.

For example, if you were trying to figure out a secret message written in code, you would need to decipher it.

Decipher is used to understand something that is hard to interpret, while solve is used to find an answer to a problem.

Decode.wordDefinition:
Decode means to convert coded or encrypted information into a form that can be understood by someone. It is applicable when there is a secret code or message that needs to be deciphered.

In simpler terms, decode means to understand a message that is hidden or encoded, and solve means to find an answer or solution to a problem or puzzle.

Fix.wordDefinition:
Fix describes correcting a problem or issue that previously existed. It is generally a temporary solution to the issue at hand.

For example, if your car has a flat tire, fixing it would involve replacing or repairing the tire so that it is functional again.

So, in short, 'fixing' is more about temporary corrections of problems while 'solving' is more about finding permanent solutions to prevent problems from coming up again in the future.

Rectify.wordDefinition:
Rectify means to correct or fix a mistake or problem, while the word solve means to find a solution to a problem or puzzle.

For example, if you made a mistake on a math problem, you would need to rectify it by finding and correcting the error.

Both words are applicable in situations where there is a problem or mistake that needs to be addressed, but rectify is more often used in situations where there is a specific mistake that needs to be corrected, while solve is more often used in situations where there is a problem that needs to be fixed or a puzzle that needs to be solved.

Resolve.wordDefinition:
The words resolve and solve are similar in meaning as they both refer to solving a problem, but there is a slight difference between them.

Resolve means to settle or find a solution to a problem or an issue. It implies finding a solution through negotiation or compromise.

For example: "We need to resolve this conflict peacefully and come to an agreement that works for everyone."

Resolve tends to refer to finding solutions to more complex or emotional problems, while solve tends to refer to finding solutions to more technical or analytical problems.

Tangle.wordDefinition:
Tangle means to become twisted or interwoven, especially in an intricate or complex way.

This word is more applicable when there is a mess that needs to be sorted out or disentangled.

For example, you would use solve if you were trying to figure out a math problem, while you would use tangle if you were trying to untangle a knot in a necklace.

Unravel.wordDefinition:
Unravel means to unravel a tangled or complicated situation. This is applicable when there is a complex problem that needs to be understood or when trying to figure out a mystery or puzzle.

Solve is about finding a solution, while unravel is about unraveling or understanding something complex.

quotes.Text: I like to work with people that I like hanging out with, that I admire, that are really smart and talented, and we can problem solve together.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Tom Cruise

quotes.Text: Don't bother people for help without first trying to solve the problem yourself.
quotes.Title: American Statesman
quotes.Name: Colin Powell

quotes.Text: It's rare that you can solve a technology problem with more technology.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Hilary Mason

quotes.Text: The problems of all of humanity can only be solved by all of humanity.
quotes.Title: Swiss Author
quotes.Name: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quotes.Text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
quotes.Title: Danish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.Text: When the actors look your character, half the problems are solved.
quotes.Title: Indian Director
quotes.Name: Priyadarshan

quotes.Text: Tell me where to sing to solve the world's problems and I'll go.
quotes.Title: Israeli Singer
quotes.Name: Netta Barzilai

quotes.Text: My comedy isn't going to solve problems; I'm not that deep.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Gary Owens

quotes.Text: Life is a mountain of solvable problems, and I enjoy that.
quotes.Title: British Designer
quotes.Name: James Dyson

quotes.Text: Peace has to be solved equally.
quotes.Title: Iraqi Politician
quotes.Name: Haider al-Abadi
